review: Writing reviews for chain restaurants is pretty gross, but I am going to make an exception here. I ended up here after the original Greek restaurant I had picked out closed at 8 PM and I needed to pick something quickly that an out of town business guest would be able to navigate to (SA highways, you are very unkind). Though I was immediately grossed out at the prospect of eating here, I was pleasantly surprised by both the service and the quality of my salad. There were a lot of people partying it up in the bar (there's not a lot to do on this side of town), so perhaps next time I'll go and get sh*tfaced with my husband. Alas, until that time, Friday's- your salad will suffice.
Other than having a little weird waitress this was a pretty good option for Thanksgiving Eve. The Korean tacos were pretty good.

Went to eat dinner and my experience was awful.Hostess sat us at a dirty table.Asked her to wipe and sweep the booth.After waiting a little bit, I grabbed rag from other table and cleaned it myself.She saw me cleaning it and gave a nasty face behind my back.I saw her through corner of my eye.Spinach dip serving was tiny at most.I ordered sizzling chicken and shrimp, serving was awful.I sent it back.There was no way I was going to pay $14 for such a tiny portion, 4 pieces of shrimp and two 1 inch round chicken medallions.Service was EXTREMELY slow. Spoke to manager Robert. He forgot to take food off of bill.He was nice and eager to rectify the situation.But damage was already done.Place was UNDERSTAFFED.DIrty tables everywhere with guests waiting to be sat.I know there were 4 tables that were dirty the entire time I was there.I ended up not eating at all.I will not be back. It took me about 45 minutes to get my check and change so that I could leave.Felt like I was trapped.

Waitress was really friendly and patient with us. They were out of seasoned fries which bummed me out but the substitute of Parmesan steak fries were awesome. Steak was okay but the ribs were fantastic. Awesome jack Daniels sauce on the husbands steak. I was a bit skeptical of the tomato and mozzarella salad but it was amazing. I couldn't stop eating it after I was full.

I had the worst dinning experience at this restaurant last night, and I'm definitely not coming back.  First of all the hamburger that I ordered it was awful, I could've gotten something better and cheaper at whataburger, second our waitress was the most incompetent person that I have deal in service wise, she not even knew the prices of anything!!!! The table that we got had no silverware, no napkins, and when they brought our food we had to ask for them, and then not even 10 minutes after we ordered the waitress brings us the check not even asking if we were gonna order anything else, she completely neglected us because she got a bigger party of people to serve.  The good thing was is that we spoke with the manager and he gave us a considerable discount on the check because we were really upset and he understood and he was helpful, but other than that nothing great about this restaurant

Food, meh. Only potstickers and chicken app for us. NOTHING special. When you work a dead bar, you really should treat paying customers (who are drinking multiples) a lot better than you do! Bartender complaining out loud about other staff, over-refilling my husband's free refill drink while mine sat empty and I had to ask for more! I was the one drinking! Had to ask to order everything, and never did order entrees since the girl never cared to ask if we wanted anything else. Lucky I tipped her. I am a former bartender/restaurant manager. I thoroughly recognize when someone needs to get out of the business.
Had a classic cheeseburger and it was lousy Carls jr would have been better, I was so disappointed. I noticed when I entered the place smelled dirty and sweaty...they really need to wash that mop
Service kind of slow. Looked like they were short on waiters. Food was ok which is expected.

Just ate at this place and I got as much fries for a $12 plate as my 6 year old son's $4.50 plate and my wife barely got any rice. $32,00 later and we are all still hungry. That just put an X on this place

Ok so my from was good, just a lil to much salt on the fries. Now the bar service was shitty. No one spoke, sat there for about 5 mins before I could even get a glass of water. And if u want a menu, u might be better off pulling it up on ur phone because it's a lil to much trouble for them.
Well were well known here so we always get good service. Love the food. I recommend it.

Seriously,  the first time we ate here it was the worst service I have ever seen.  The staff seemed to care less about anything.  The food was fair.  Because the service was so bad I actually emailed the corporate office.  They contacted me and apologized and asked that we give them another chance.  Last night our family went back to try again.  The hostess was yawning when she flopped down our menus on the table.  She never closed her mouth or said excuse me or anything.  The service was extremely slow and our waitress acted as if she really wanted to be somewhere else!  We had to ask for everything ( just like our first visit) including silverware, drink refills, napkins, etc.  the chicken fingers were like frozen ones you can get at the grocery store.  The hamburger that my sister asked for with no pink had pink and the fries tasted like old grease.  The house salad had big hunks of lettuce, 2 grape tomatoes, and four croutons ... my son counted them...lol!  Needless to say my husband and I agreed that we will not be going back there!

We were visiting from out of town, the overall experience was okay. The hostess (who seated us) was rude and half assed cleaned the table, she was visibly pissed and tossed our silverware on the table.  However the server made up for her co-worker. Our server was AWESOME!!!!. Even though she had a large party she was still attentive and super nice.  Food: I didn't mind the food taking awhile to come out because it was hot and fresh!  Interior: Tables could've been cleaned better and it was stale smelling inside.

This was my attempt to give them a second chance after the horrible experience I had last time; this time it was worse.  The wait for a table was normal for a Saturday night but I noticed that 6 tables near the door were not being used. After nearly 40 minutes to get our food, my plate was wrong. Not only was it wrong but we waited another 10 min for utensils because "all the silverware was dirty."  I talked to two managers and they both assured me that this was not typical. I explained that this was my second time dining and the second time service was poor.  You have many dining options nearby. I would suggest you save yourself the two hour wait and go to any other restaurant.

This review is only for the bar, as I've never sat in the restaurant. I am not a huge fan of Friday's, but my coworkers enjoy coming here for lunch every now and then, therefore I tag along. There's usually hardly anyone in the restaurant as early as we go (11am). This is not the worst Fridays EVER, although the other reviews certainly suggest it is. I'm happy with it overall. Cheyenne is a wonderful bartender/server. She's friendly, happy, and very attentive. We sit at the bar because we really enjoy dining with her. I am picky about my order; I ask for sauces on the side and no bun, substitutions and all. They've never messed it up. The food comes out promptly. Our beers are refilled and so far the food has been consistent. I like their Sedona black bean burger. All of the employees are really friendly. The door is opened on your way in, and of course the bar service is good. Honestly, in comparison to the service and  food quality, this Fridays has been more consistent than the neighboring restaurants (Buffalo Wild Wings/Twin Peaks).

Considering Twin Peaks opened next door and is stealing most of the business in this area I thought service would be on point to keep the clientele? Wrong. Apparently the waitresses are here to hang out with each other and their friends, not work the tables. I won't be back. Too many places to spend your dollars in SA.

The worst dining experience I have ever had. That is what my wife said and the rest of her family. I also agree with this statement. Appetizers took 45 minutes.. rest of the food took over an hour and management never came to apologize or even mention it. Our bill took 30 minutes to get after being wrong the first time. Talked to manager and he was defensive and said he would adjust the bill. He made us wait 15 minutes before bringing us back a bill that was about $40 higher. Waited another 15 minutes and he came back with a bill adjusted by $12 from my bill that was over $100 and only $4 for my brother in-laws bill. I can only assume that he was messing with us and being facetious. Worst service ever. Bad management. I had the bleu bacon burger and it was dried out and cold. The rest of the food was good though.

Not really sure why this place is scored so low. People keep stating that it is gross because it is a chain restaurant but if you don't like chain restaurants why did you come here? I hate McDonald's so guess what I don't go there. *vent done* on to my review.  So my sexy husband and I came here after getting tired of waiting for someone to take our order next door at Twin Peaks. I ordered Jack Daniel's steak, spinach, and mac and cheese. My husband had some sort of Cajun chicken shrimp pasta. The food was all great my only gripe is that they seemed short staffed because everyone was in the kitchen and there was one waiter running around like a chicken with their head cut off. He was not inattentive but he certainly could have come around more. We enjoyed our food and aside from the fact that they don't have steak sauce, like wtf?, everything was great.

Here for my birthday dinner on a Friday night. Wait time wasn't more than 30 minutes. Alcoholic beverages were nothing more than juice with maybe a tiny bit of alcohol that could not be tasted. The bartender could add a shot for $5 more so the drinks were returned. When the food arrived it was lukewarm. One of the salads had (non cooked) ice-cold chicken and was missing the avocado. Our server Latifa checked up on us only to get our orders, didn't refill any drinks the entire time, didn't ask if our food was okay, and at one point smelled of cigarette. She did apologize for the inconveniences but had it been good service it may have made up for the food and drinks. Needles to say I'm headed elsewhere for drinks for the evening.

Disappointed again. Stood at the front for at least 5 minutes before the hostess even acknowledged us. The place was empty but we were told the wait would be about 10 minutes. Our waitress was very friendly. I got the Parmesan crusted chicken with Mac n cheese and tomato and mozzarella salad. The tomatoes  were frozen. My chicken was disgusting! I think it was cooked then frozen and recooked. It was rubbery and had a weird texture. The Mac n cheese was really good. I will not be going back anytime soon.

How was the food and service here? I don't know. We were seated, waited for 20 minutes without any server acknowledging us or asking what we wanted to drink, so we left. Also, it's worth mentioning that most of the tables were empty as well, so it's a bit amazing that my group wasn't acknowledged by a server after 20 minutes...

Came here to for dinner on a Thursday the place wasn't busy at all. We got seated right away as we walked in. Sat for about 10 minutes staring at the menu. No one acknowledged us! 3 waiters and waitresses passed by nothing. (Stared at them making eye contact to make it even more obvious and nothing) So we got up and left went to another restaurant in the shopping center. I won't be coming back here ever!!

My family and I went out to Fridays on hwy 151 and 410 west to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We arrive at 8pm and was told there was a 20min wait. We waited  for 40mins before being seated. The waiteress did not come to our table to take orders for another 30mins. Our appettizers arrived cold and stale looking. Our food looked like leftovers, as the vegetables   and rice was crunchy almost as though it's been reheated but it actually was not warm. The waitress did not check on us. We had to get her attention to provide us with napkins, which she never brought. After the meal we waited at the table for more than 30 mins and she never came to clear the table. We then went over to the host to ask for our checks and to speak to the manager. We complained to the manager who responded by saying that she will talk to the waitress. Well, the waitress comes back with the check, throws the check on the table as she is walking by our table. I asked to speak to the manager again who comes out telling me that she will discount only one of the 5 stale meals they served us.  It was a horrible restaurant experience!!!
Because I had to give a star. Bad service. It took 15-20 min to get a server. Anger talking to the manager she finally came. The food sucks nothing like the commercial says it will be. Never again..

I was starving and this place popped up as a nearby location as my hungry eyes scoured Yelp for nearby locations after a failed attempt to order from a local Greek restaurant fell by the wayside. Typical TGI Fridays chain. No better and no worse. The horrible rating seems a bit harsh after two visits here while in San Antonio. The first visit was for take-out. The person taking my order clearly didn't know the menu at all. She had to put me on hold to verify what I ordered and she didn't even know that the menu had TGI Fridays Shrimp. The second time, we came back  to celebrate my niece's BMT Graduation because my niece's favorite restaurant is TGI Fridays. The GPS could NOT locate this restaurant on its own, so I was forced to actually use my eyes and look around. Luckily it is lined up in the front of a plaza alongside several other eateries.

We came in as a group 30 min before they closed. the closer had no menu knowledge at all. I asked about their daily drink special, she said she didn't know(didn't offer to check either/ I had to ask if she could check) When taking our food order- she didn't know how to modify the order. She didn't understand the menu- their for didn't understand what we were asking. She had to go to the bartender several times to ask questions. We were the ONLY table inside and a margarita took forever to be placed and/or made. The food took more than 25 min to be executed and expo. I usually don't make a big deal about things like this, but we were the only table inside and our order was not difficult.  When one person complained about a side and asked to have it replaced with a different side- she charged him for the side. The food- is horrible. I'm not sure if they over prep their food and that's why it taste bad, or if it's because the recipes are not being executed properly , or if the recipes are meant to actually taste this bad. The rice tasted sour, old, and mushy. The meatballs were grey! The pork tacos was old- the corn tortilla was stale. The pork had no seasoning.  I don't Blame the staff foh or kitchen. I blame the management here. He rather sit and be friendly with his staff instead of being concerned about the guest that are their experience and how his store is running. We clearly were not happy and not once did he make an effort to try to make our negative experience into a positive experience.  Working in this field,any kind of bad review was a training tool to help the restaurant succeed and become better. I am not writing this review for their benefit- they have plenty of bad reviews (all about the same thing- management, food, and service). I am writing this review for people who come in from out of town and can't decide where to eat. I am writing this for their home office so they know that the reason tgif is not succeeding is not because of other competition but because of their lack to fix problems within house. This establishment is not worth anyone's time or money.  I write this review not wanting my money or time back- but to warn others that when it comes to their money they have every right to get a great experience with service and have food that is satisfactory. This place can not pass either of these options.

Ordered a Fat Tire Beer.... They were out Order steak and lobster....they were out of lobster Ordered they sirloin steak.  They brought out ribs??!! Some dumb kids worker went outside the emergency exit and set off the alarm??  Not a relaxing enjoyable experience.

So I'm not sure why it has such a bad rating but I loved the fact I was able to get 2 chicken breasts and jasmine rice with broccoli for like 12$ the service was great and it was fast to seat and serve! My kids got meals they loved so aka and all we will be coming back here

Worst experience.. EVER! I ordered three entrees to go, but when I got home to enjoy my meal, I was disgusted to find RAW chicken in my dish. But not on just one, but on all three. After trying to contact the GM of the restaurant for about THREE weeks, leaving my name and number.. I heard nothing back. Finally, I got in touch with one who said we can settle "minimal compensation".. When I went to pick up the corrected order, as a guest recovery order, the manager expected me to pay AGAIN.. After being told it was free for the mistake. I was promised three and received two. I called the next morning to speak with a manager and the girl who answered told me, "We are really busy. Call back in about 2 hours.".. Didn't bother to take a message, show concern for my issues. I just don't think I can go back to this location. I've contacted corporate to discuss this "minimal compensation" and I do hope to see a better recovery from their main office.

Waiting 2 hours for a regular entree is ridiculous, and the place wasn't busy.  Manager was severely inept, didn't try to fix the situation, even after it was brought to his attention. Won't come here again.

FOUND A PIECE OF METAL IN MY FOOD!!! I came in with a group of about 8 people for lunch and the place was pretty dead which had us wondering but we decided to give it a chance anyways. The service and staff was okay at first nothing to complain about. I ordered the baby back ribs with spinach and broccoli, when they came out they looked pretty good. I ate the ribs which tasted fine and I was happy with, the broccoli was still raw and according to three other ppl at my table who had ordered broccoli as well it was a common theme. I started eating the spinach last and on my third bite felt a sharp pain in my mouth, I thought I had broken a tooth. I reached into my mouth and pulled out a piece of metal about the size of a staple covered in grime and could immediately taste blood. I calmly asked for the waiter and he asked if he could see it to show his boss. He comes back to the front later and is joking with the hostess before coming back to my table and explaining that it must be from the wire brush they use to clean the grill when they make ribs and such. I explained that while that was an interesting story what was it doing imbedded in the spinach?!? He said "Oh yea it must've gotten in that", my party and I were left in shock and that was the last we saw of anyone before they brought the check. I would think a manager would want to come speak to a patron who had just bit into a nasty piece of metal but I guess only a death in the restaurant would warrant his appearance from on high. I was in my work uniform so I did not flip out as I wanted to but rest assured I am contacting the health board and code compliance to file a complaint on the ineptitude of the cooks and management. For the love of God and all things holy avoid this place unless you want to get a tetanus shot!
This place is great, not over rated or crowded like Buffalo Wild Wings the bartenders are great. If Jordan is there he will definitely take care of you. I think I've officially become a regular

Great service at the bar. Bartenders are always attentive. Our bartender tonight was Jordan, he was awesome! Quick to serve us and always made sure we were comfortable. We'll definitely be back to visit him!

Will not be back. Went here last weekend and was very disappointed. Service was with an attitude, food was only ok. The only choice you have for burgers is well and well done? $18 for a bad piece of fish less than the size of a post it note? Flat sodas and crappy tea. Not sure what was going on that Saturday afternoon but they lost loyal customers that day. May try other TGI locations but not that one.

Everyone I come it's because it convenient.  The food is blan, cold and nasty.  The service staff is slow, forgetful and unorganized. I will drive the extra mile to avoid this place.  Really not worth it. You will get a better meal at home eating Ramen.

We came here because 54th was packed. I began to get upset because the wait for food took a whole hour.. but the cook..mind you the only one that showed up..who also happened to be a manager came and personally apologized and made everything right. His sincerity and genuine soul makes it to where we will come back again. Times are hard.. we understand.
Long waits, mediocre food, a stream of water flowing from the men's bathroom, and we were overcharged too. Definitely skip this location.

I'm normally like TGI Friday... It took over an hour for us to get out seats with minimal people there. We noticed several tables were open from where the waiting area was. Once we finally got our table and we were seated it took another 20 mins before someone came over to get our drink order. We were all trying desperately to order our food because God only knew when we'd see our waitress again. She came back with our drinks shortly thereafter and began taking orders for food. My plate was by far the worst of everyone at my table. My pasta looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for about 3 days. The pasta was hard, dry, and had like 4 shrimp. My kids didn't eat their chicken tenders because they told me after our meal that just really weird. My kids are not picky eaters either. When my boy doesn't want to eat something it's because it's either rotten or it just got pooped on basically. The meal was over, my family and I were all desperate to get out of there before we saw any rats or bugs scurry out of the kitchen. I decided to use the restroom and noticed there was no soap. So I can only imagine how many plates of food were cooked with dirty hands. Disgusted and horrified at this point I just wanted to leave. We had to wait an additional 30 mins for our dessert after we had to order initially wait 15 mins, and then wait another 15 mins because she came back and asked "Did you want that to go or for here?" We had had already stated the first time that we wanted it to go when we ordered the dessert the first time after our meals were done. Then we get home and of course the dessert order was wrong. Ordered a whiskey cake and got a brownie instead. I guess that's what i get for trusting them they would've made right on all the previous mistakes. If you feel like complaining to the manager the whole night I'm sure you'll get good service because he seems to be the only employee there who actually gives a crap about quality service. Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy and would rather re-deploy to Iraq and eat in a mud hut in downtown Mosul before eating at this establishment ever again.

Thought we would retry this place after a bad experience 2 years ago (bad food). I should of trusted my gut and not return. We sat at the bar and ordered appetizers and drinks. The appetizer was horrible. potato skins looked rotten, dry and over fried with a chunk of unmelted cheese. The pretzels looked old, chicken wings had no chicken and was only fried skin. We had to return it. felt bad for the bartender, it wasn't his fault. Beer tab was dirty too. Unless everything else is closed and your starving don't eat here.
The food was alright.  Over priced menu compared to other places like Chilis or Cheddars. Service was horrible.  Server was in the restroom most of the time and the food was cold.

I've been going to Friday's for many years. I've never had any complaints for 15 years. This location was hands down the worst service and food I've ever experienced. Long waits, cold food, etc. The owner should be embarrassed. What is wrong with San Antonio's food service industry? It seems like nobody knows what good customer service is in this city.
Pleasant host and waiter. Had to wait 35-40mins for food to come even though the restaurant was very empty. Food was expensive in comparison to portion served.

Don't know why such low ratings,  this place was legit.  Good was good and service was impeccable.  Don't pay attention to the bad reviews they are incorrect. Go for the unlimited Apps, good Friday and lots of food!

Worst experience at a restaurant ever. Absolutely do not go to this location. We were seated at 8:10pm...at 9:30 our appetizer was finally brought to our table...cold!!! This was after us complaining and the kitchen manager promised to "make it right." Our waiter was more concerned with flirting with the young girl at the table next to us than taking our order, keeping our drinks filled, and making sure we got our food. The second waitress only seemed concerned with my husband getting his drink refilled and never asked me if I wanted a refill. Seriously, they couldn't even bring us our entire appetizer or all the sauces that went with it. The manager never even bothered to come to our table. I finally flagged down the hostess and let her know that we were leaving and we absolutely would not be paying for anything, and we just walked out. I've never done that, ever. The owner, manager, and kitchen manager should be completely embarrassed of the type of establishment they are running. Avoid this place like the plague. Do yourself a favor and drive a mile further to Cheddars, were they know how to treat their customers.
My 5 star rating is only based off of the bartender Mike. He was excellent with knowledge of alcoholic drinks and served an amazing margarita. The food is so-so.
The chicken and shrimp was creamy and with perfect flavoring after I asked for no bacon or onions. Paired with a peach Long Island ice tea- it was a nice dinner

I wish I would have looked on here before we stopped in tonight. I was craving JD chicken and talked my husband into giving this place a second try.  1. It's still dirty. I sat near the same spot a few months ago and the dust with "clean me" written was still there. The light fixtures haven't been cleaned in a long time too. The bathroom floor tried to keep my flip flops. It's gross. I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like.  2. Our server did not listen at all to our order. He came back and "double checked" and still managed to give us the wrong food. Then when we asked him to fix the bill (twice), he didn't. He just handed us the ticket and walked away.  3. It wasn't busy and the process of placing the order, getting refills, and getting our check took way too long. Now that girl at the bar was pretty but flirting is not a job. If you want to flirt, at least get my order right and refill my husband's water. Water is free. Always refill water. That's server 101.  4. My chicken was pink. Sometimes with the red lights it can just look pink. However as I'm typing this, I can tell from the noises in my gut that it was indeed pink.  We will never go back. There are recipes on the internet for the JD sauce so I can make it myself.

Early Dine menu is great! $8.99 had over 11 entrees to choose from. Of course your still get the complimentary bread that is really delicious. Fresh, hot, and right out of the oven.  Menu is available Mon-Fri until 6 and Fri-Sat until 2.

The server was kind how ever,I was not sure if the kitchen was messing with his orders or if they were messing with us. ( my son was wearing his Airman dress blues). We ordered two build your own burgers. One bun was hard and dry any eh burgers were burnt. We also ordered a nacho and a specialty salad. We're were told after the burgers came that they did not have nachos we had been sitting 25 minutes by then. After then the sand came and was wrong.  Were were then charged for two salads. It was not a good experience  hoping it was not because my sons attire!

We cut into a steak that was ordered here and immediately smelled something horrid at our table. We soon realized it was coming from the steak. We called the manager over and asked him to smell the steak and asked if he was proud to serve that. He smelled it, said no, then walked away(no apology, no other word out of his mouth). Our waitress  comes back and gives us our check and says that they took off the steak order. That's all that was said, not once did the manager aplogize or our waitress aplogize or anything close to an apology. Their meat was rotten, and they have too poor of management and staff to handle that situation correctly. We weren't expecting our whole ticket to be canceled out and a free meal out of it. However, I was expecting at least an apology for the spoiled meat that was served to us.

I got the $10 rack of ribs and it was $10 worth of ribs.  Not terrible but for $10 you get what you get.  Tasted good just not very meaty.  My wife got the mahi mahi and she liked it enough.  The $10 value menu is a good deal.  The service was decent and the restaurant was clean albeit dated.  Very dated TGIF might wanna think about a complete overhaul

By far the worst service experience I have ever had. I am a firm believer in treating the servers and cooking staff with the most proper etiquette and respect but when they forget your order for an hour and neglect your table for the majority of your dinner it becomes a very disappointing experience. Needless to say, the extremely forgetful manager and "enthusiastic" wait staff left a bad taste in my mouth. Don't waste your time or money, this is a Friday's I will not 'thank God' for.  PS - the bill was rung up wrong three times.

If no stars was possible that'd apply here. Worst service ever, including the manager who forgot our order as well. Took 55 minutes to get our drinks, 4x to get our bill "right" and it was still wrong on the end. Don't waste your time or money. And to top off everyone was sweating because it was so hot including all of the wait staff/manager. Hadn't been In years and won't be back. Should have known.
Leaky roof, dirty silverware, old chicken, overall dirty place. Had I checked the reviews I would have made another selection.

We got to the restaurant around 4:30 and it was empty.  We sat ourselves and none of the waitresses came to help us. We sat for 10 minutes while they all laughed and talked in the corner with the manager. Finally a man came over and took our drink order. He was pretty rude and seemed bothered. We ordered some appetizers which came out quickly. The potato skins were dry and frankly disgusting. The wings, potstickers, and cheese sticks were delicious. There were gnats everywhere which made an unpleasant experience.

We always love Fridays and tonight we had a great experience at this location ! I ordered one of the appetizers as my entree and it was the sriracha shrimp roll (sounded amazing!).. After we got our appetizer the manager (Jason) came out and broke the news they were out of the rice they use for the dish I ordered.. At first I was really sad but then he said he had an idea to replace the rice with a potsticker .. I love potstickers so I agreed .. Jason personally brought the dish out to me and not only was it beautiful but it was amazing !!! He easily could've told me they were out of rice and I had to choose a new dish, but he went above and beyond and it was so so appreciated! Great customer service!

Honestly I don't come here to eat cause the food is not all That good but I always sit at the bar and come here to drink ! They have happy hour all day and on top of that they have another different happy hour for each day !! Jordan is great at the bar always takes care of me . But yeah I don't come here to eat only to drink !

Wow! It's been awhile since I last went to TGI Friday's but it was a great experience! It wasn't busy surprisingly but that was great for us! We just wanted to grub and have some drinks! The appetizers were good I really liked  the mozzarella sticks and wings. They had some drinks specials and the manager and servers were very friendly! Jordan was our bartender and it was very patient he explained the menu to us since it's been awhile and was willing to accommodate our needs! I will definitely be back!  The only bad thing would probably be the location since it's kind of hidden in the corner for 410 and there's a lot of construction on this side.

Horrible experience!  Visited on a Saturday at 5:30pm and the place was nearly empty. Walked in and hostess didn't even greet us. We were given a booth with 3 of the dirtiest, worn out menus I've ever seen at a restaurant. After waiting 10 minutes with no one acknowledging us we got up and left. I will never go to this TGI Friday's again!!!

Just not the best by any means.  I have really tried to like various TGI Fridays over the last ten years, but to no avail.  On my most recent experience I had the cajun shrimp and chicken pasta.  It just really failed to deliver - even for a place like this. The draft beer was flat. The service was mediocre at best. We didn't even get eatin' utensils.  I had to take them from another table myself. The only good thing about this place is the short wait. But if you are looking for decent food, try one of their nearby competitors.

Great food & drinks, but better than that was the great service. From the moment we walked through the door, we were greeted with smiles. Elaine was our server and was very friendly. Shabazz is a new manager and was fantastic. I definitely recommend this place for lunch or even just drinks and apps!

Food is amazing as always, as well as the service. The entire crew makes the experience fun and friendly. Jason, the manager definitely has an awesome crew with him. Destiny is 5 out 5 star worker! Attentive and very funny

Used to be my favorite place. I havent been since october, and well i wont come back ever again.  For one reason only, the bartender couldn't make a margarita. The worse one ive ever had in my life! Almost the whole glass consisted of sweet and sour. Me and my mom took one sip and we both said hell no! We then told another bartender to make us another one but she didnt, instead she told the same bartender to make it again. Well after waiting for 6 mins, we still never got our remakes. So we walked out. I don't know what happened to the old crew but this new crew sucks period. Lucky for us bubbas 33 just opened around the corner, so they will keep getting my money.
This place sucks. Service is rough, Destiny at the bar did whatever the hell she wanted and cleaning took priority over customers and the bathrooms were trashed.

Service is absolute shit!!!!!!! I waited there at my table for over an hour waiting for my food. It wasn't even busy. Never going back.  I didn't get my food, I left and went next door to IHOP. Plus I waited 15minutes for a table that was open when I walked in.

Just attempted to eat dinner here tonight. Empty parking lot and restaurant. Yet when I asked for a table for 6, they said sorry, the wait is 45 minutes!  No one else was in the lobby waiting either. I'm guessing they're going out of business if they can't figure out how to seat anyone. Went next door to Chilis and they were packed.  But, the hostess was able to get us seated within 10 minutes.

For sure the absolute worst Friday's I have been to. No one to greet at the door , stood there about 8 minutes alone. Ordered the all you can eat apps and that was a mistake. It took approximately 20 minutes after finishing one and getting another one. Sat there a little over 2 hours and only got 4 apps in that time (do the math). And the restaurant was empty too (see pic)The quality of the apps themselves were  mediocre at best. The plates were dirty and the staff working were the loudest group of staff at a restaurant I have ever heard . Yelling across the restaurant like it was an outdoor concert. Horrible experience and Friday's inc. should be embarrassed . I work in the hospitality industry and have my whole life, if this was my restaurant I would be mortified. Will NEVER- EVER return to this location!

Poor customer service. We went here to get lunch as a group.  By the time the rest of our group finished their meals, three of us still did not get our  meal.  So they apologize and said that our meal was being complementary which we did not ask for.  The group was finished and we were heading to meeting. I still did have a meal.  So  I asked that they bring out my meal to go since i still did not have to eat it at the table.  As i went to pay, management said that they changed their mind.  Since it was now a "to-go" order, i have to pay for my meal.  I get the concept of paying for goods and services.   But many thanks to the TGIF management for letting me sit through an entire lunch without food.  I promise I won't make that mistake again at this TGIF location.  Please make sure you warn your patrons that there's a possibility that just because you sit down to order food, it doesn't mean that you will get to eat it as you sit.

Enjoyed the staff and I appreciated the appetizers. The bar service was great and Anthony was cool and made sure that me and the guest I was with were well taken care of. I don't live on this side of town but when I am here, I'll keep this place in mind for sure.

I couldn't rate this place zero stars, so I put one star. First off- We requested a booth and one finally opened up. Hostess told me that we couldn't sit there because the server had a party of 8 and couldn't handle another party of 3. After another booth opened up we were told they would not seat us because the kitchen was understaffed and way behind. Customers were complaining about the wait for their food and I observed another customer walking their check to the bar.  One of the hostesses tried to say that since we wanted a booth we had to wait longer.  Well, two booths were open so she could have kept her simple minded comments to herself. Bad experience overall.

This is really good we stopped here after meeting to have a drink they had a martini Wednesdays they have some really good martinis and we had the $10 apps we had about three apps The fried pickles which we weird because they were like french fries...  we also had The meatballs and The boneless wings The best thing of all was my husband and I were able to have a great conversation and enjoy our time together.

Hadn't been to this location in awhile so my boyfriend and I decided try it out again. We were greeted and sat at a booth. The table was a bit sticky, the wall connected to the booth looked like food had been splattered and never cleaned up. We were greeted by our waiter John. He was very nice and patient with our ordering. He'd always made sure our drinks were filled and checked to see if we were doing okay. I had no issues at all with john, just to be clear. The food was average, I ordered the endless wing appetizer and they were okay. My boyfriend got the chicken and cheese plate, he seemed to enjoy it but too much for him to finish. Overall the customer service was great but very average food.

My wife, mother and I felt like a light late lunch early dinner and since I had never been to a TGIFriday's my wife recommended it since she had been to many in New England. I will have to say the host was quick in seating us and it was a good location due to the fact that my mother is in a wheel chair. They accommodated quickly to her; however, not soo much for my 6 month old daughter. I asked for a high chair and one never came even though it was right by the host stand and then I did get one my self and the strap was broken so I got another one all while the host watched. We did get a server named Myriah and she was prompt in the beginning and brought us our drinks promptly and they were good. We all quickly noticed however we didn't have any napkins or silverware. I would have asked my server for some but she was MIA for a good 10-15 min. I don't know if she had another section on the other side of the restaurant or what. I finally saw another server on a high top table rolling silverware so I asked if I could have some and a few extra napkins. I was informed reason being we didn't have any silver was due to none being rolled.  The server took our order and when asked what soup was best didn't really have an opinion since she stated she didn't like soup. We had 2 salads and my mom had the 1/2 rack of ribs. The restaurant got 3 stars due to the food. The food was above average for a chain restaurant and the ribs were absolutely great according to my mom tender and juicy and fell off the bone. The service is really the only thing I would have to say needs to be improved. The décor may be a little dated but it isn't horrible reminds me of an older Ruby Tuesday's. All in all it is ok. I may give it another shot because of the food. I just hope the service gets better.

I love love love Friday's. Coming from the east coast where it's really popular, this location doesn't disappoint in terms of the food. It's the same flavor and value that's expected from any Friday's.  The reason for the low rating is due to the astounding lack of professionalism that we witnessed at this location. We sat in the bar area, and saw a few of the servers huddled by the kitchen window. They were all on their phones, using profanity, and seemed utterly oblivious to the fact that customers were within earshot. Then, the manager came out and asked the employees about whether or not another employee called out or didn't show up to work a couple of days ago. Her tone was so unprofessional. It sounded as though she was gossiping about the employee. The manager then sat down at the bar several feet away, took out her phone, and was chatting with some of their servers as though there were no customers around. I couldn't believe it. Throughout the rest of our meal, the manager hung out with the servers, and they continued to use their phones, use profanity, and essentially ignore the entire bar area.  Thankfully the bartender was pretty attentive and we didn't have any issues with our meal or anything like that. But the servers and the manager were so unprofessional that it was super uncomfortable for us.

Goodness where do I start. A 20 to 30 min wait time, and an additional 30 mins on your food order. You have to ask for additional napkins condiments, etc and lets pray your glass will get refilled in a timely manner. Their tortilla chips and salsa are drenched in cooking oil so be prepared for exiting to the bathroom. The only reason I even entertain going back there is because my daughter loves their baby back rib meals. Their chicken Cesar salad sucked horribly and was so tart that I had to repair it when I got home for having a decent meal because I did not want to cook. This meal was not worth the $40 spent.  I have had better buffet salads.

We loved that TGIFriday's was open late.  We got a variety of appetizers and entrees for the table and everyone shared.  it was a fun, casual evening complemented with good food and excellent service.  I'd go there again.

Bottom less appetizers never started guess they didn't have enough sauce for the wings and ranch because next to nothing was given,order lava drink never came ,was not even busy and the waiter failed to show up so after waiting a while I just asked for the check and left .horrible
Slow service, beer was flat and sent it back and crackers were stale. Just came for a light dinner, but very disappointed. I love TGI Fridays but won't be back to this location.
Restroom was nasty .  Waited 39 minutes to get my drink.... RIDICULOUS    Don't waste your time going there.  When I finally got my drink I asked for the bill and left.

The waitress didn't pay attention when we ordered we ordered 2 buffalo burgers with the wings on top and my mom asked for no spicy mayo or pickles and the waitress brought it out like that and when my mom started to eat it she realized it had all she didn't ask for and end up getting sick she can't eat too much spicy foods. I asked for my burger well done I noticed it was medium rare I got Sick I wouldn't recommend it here and it was our first time eating here.
